text.text_translated:
Many artists sell many albums.
They are best-selling album artists.
But they stop making new music.
Bruce Springsteen is different.
He still makes new music.
His music is chart-topping.
His music is stadium-filling.
He is in his late 60s.
He is still at the top of his game.
This does not surprise me.
He tells us our most basic stories about ourselves.
Listen to his song "Born in the USA."
These stories are important today.
They were always important.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: Vocabulary Deviation. The text contains words above the A2 level, which is unacceptable for the target CEFR level. The word 'basic' is classified as B1. The word 'making' is classified as B2. Both words must be replaced with A2-level vocabulary. Suggestion: Replace 'basic' with 'simple'. Suggestion: Replace 'making' with 'creating'.

This does not surprise me.
He tells us our most basic stories about ourselves.
Listen to his song "Born in the USA."
These stories are important today.
